GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "21 CFR Part 11 Compliance Assessment".

ItemGroupDef.Name: Controls for identification of Codes / Passwords

Question.TranslatedText: Which electronic records in the system, if any, require signature per predicate rule or internal SOP?
List interfaces to other systems either used for GXP data captures or to export GXP data to other systems.
Identify key system personnel including: User and user groups, system owner, system administrator.
Provide an overview of the system platform and architecture relative to security, audit logs.
Where ER/ES have been identified, has the functionality been validated against 21 CFR Part 11?
Are existing procedural controls in place that provide an interim solution and reduce the risk of non-compliance?
Has a review of the use of signatures been carried out against each record maintained by the system?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is the system fully documented including HW/SW controls, lifecycle development documentation and operational procedures and manuals?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Has an assessment of ER maintained by the system been made in order to identify those required to be submitted to FDA electronically vs. those required for operational use?
Applicability of the Records to the System
For those records to be submitted, have they been identified in Public Docket No. 92S-T as being a type 0251 submission which the FDA accepts in electronic form?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is the system closed or open?
Has the system been validated to ensure accuracy, reliability, consistent intended performance, and the ability to discern invalid or altered records?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures and/or plans in place to manage GXP record retention for the defined retention period?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are suitable backup and restoration procedures in place?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are disaster recovery procedures in place to ensure that ER and applications can be restored to a known point following data loss or corruption?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are security procedures in place in order to ensure that only authorized users are granted access to the system? That users leaving the institution or changing roles are de-authorized from access to the system?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are records in place to demonstrate that individuals involved in the development, maintenance, administration and operation of ERES systems have the education, training and experience to perform their job?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are written policies in place that hold individuals accountable and responsible for actions initiated under their ES?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to control access, maintenance and distribution of system documentation?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are change control procedures in place to manage changes to systems and system documentation?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to ensure uniqueness of ES and that they are not re-used or re-allocated?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do system access authorization procedures include verification of the identity of personnel before granting access?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are records in place to demonstrate that individuals associated with the use, operation and administration of the system understand and accept that the use of a specific electronic signature is the legally binding equivalent of the signers hand written signature?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are policies in place to ensure personnel do not disclose their ES?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to periodically review user accounts in order to determine that access authorizations are still appropriate?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to ensure that user profiles and access rights are controlled?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to ensure that passwords are periodically changed?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are procedures in place to manage the loss of passwords and their reissue?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are procedures in place to distinguish between intended security violations and those arising from personnel forgetting security codes? Do these procedures address the investigation of intended security violations ?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Where security input devices are utilized, are procedures in place to periodically test the devices or tokens?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are automated controls in place to detect unauthorized changes to electronic records ?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Can the system generate both in human readable and electronic form, accurate and complete copies of records for inspection, review and copying by regulatory agencies?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Where records are exported, are they secure from modification and falsification and is the system able to detect modification to records re-imported for viewing?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are devices that store ER (e.g., file/database servers and backup and archive devices) located in controlled areas or physically secure ?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are systems used to store ER installed in environmentally controlled areas?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system provide functionality to detect or prevent users from manipulating, overriding, or otherwise invalidating ER, application code or the operating environment of the system?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are file servers and host computers operating using USP, or other battery backup measures in order to facilitate controlled system shutdown?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system ensure that data cannot be recreated after system failure such as synchronized forward data recovery and error processing for database applications?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Where ER are replicated in different systems, are measures in place to ensure record synchronization?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system prevent concurrent update of ER by multiple users or processes?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system ensure that for unsuccessful multi-stage updates to ER, all fields associated with the record are restored to their original state? (e.g. rollback)
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do back-up functions maintain synchronization between ER distributed across different systems?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are security controls provided to restrict access to components of the application, such as screens and reports, or data and functions such as read, update or deleted by user or user group?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system provide security measures to control remote access to a closed system?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are remote access sessions automatically logged-off when the session is terminated?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system enable user access rights to be displayed or printed including User ID and all of their access permissions? (e.g., file access, grants, permissions, etc.
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is access to ER by ordinary means prevented other than via the validated user interface?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system generate audit trail records for all create, modification and deletion operations and contain: record reference; modification date and time; old data; new data; User ID?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are system users prevented from modifying the system clock?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are audit trails secure from modification either by means of tools provided by the application or by other applications such as SQL, database packages, text editors, etc.?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is the audit trail documentation retained with the associated ER for a period at least as long as that required for the ER and is the audit trail available for agency review and copying?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is previously recorded information still available for review following modification and is such information identified in the audit trail?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are operator entries traceable to a User ID that can be uniquely linked to its owner?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are critical operator actions (e.g., create, insert, delete, modify) identified in, or deducted from the audit trail?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is there a display or report available for viewing the audit trail?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is it possible to export audit trail information securely, without risk of modification or falsification?
Applicability of the Records to the System
When audit trail records are exported for backup, archive or other means, does the system record the date/time of export, User ID, number of records exported?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are all authorizations, approvals and other critical operations recorded in the audit trail?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system utilize logical checks to enforce sequencing of steps and events, as appropriate?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do user sessions automatically log-off when a session disconnect is detected?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Does the system utilize device checks (e.g. terminal) to determine, as appropriate, the validity of the source data input or operational instructions? (this applies to systems requiring additional access control to ensure data was entered from a specific device)
Applicability of the Records to the System

Does the system provide controls to ensure the authenticity, integrity and as appropriate, the confidentiality of ER from the point of their creation to the point of their receipt? (such controls may include document encryption and use of appropriate digital signature standards to ensure record authenticity, integrity and confidentiality. Example of encryption standards are RSA, NISTs DDS)
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system include as part of any human readable form of signed electronic records: printed name of the signer; date/time when signature was executed; meaning associated with the signature?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are ES and hand-written signatures linked to their respective ERs so that the signature cannot be repudiated, excised, copied or otherwise transferred to falsify an ER by ordinary means?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are electronic or hand-written signatures applied and linked when changes are made to previously authorized/approved ER?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do hybrid systems have robust procedures to ensure ERs are synchronized with approved paper records?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system ensure that a signature of another person cannot replace previously executed ES, even if that person is a supervisor or manager?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are electronic signatures unique to one individual?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are measures in place to prevent reuse and reassignment of ES?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do ES contain at least two distinct ID components, such as an ID code and password, and is at least one component confidential to the owner?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Does the system ensure that when an individual executes a series of signings during a single, continuous period of controlled system access, the first signing is executed using all ES components? (subsequent signings can be executed by one ES component that is only executable by and designed to be used only by the individual)
Applicability of the Records to the System

When an individual executes one or more signings not performed during a single, continuous period of controlled system access, does the system ensure that each signing is executed using all of the ES components?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Is the ES system designed to ensure that attempted use of an individual's ES by anyone other than its genuine owner requires collaboration of two or more individuals?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system prevent access to ES information by ordinary means?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are ES based upon biometrics designed to ensure that they cannot be used by anyone other than their genuine owner?
Applicability of the Records to the System

ItemDef.Name: req_70_yesno
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: Controls for identification of Codes / Passwords

Question.TranslatedText: Does the system ensure that identification codes are unique and allow for personnel who may have the same name?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do the system(s) force users to periodically change their password?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system provide controls that prevent re-use of recently used passwords?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Do passwords contain a minimal number of characters to prevent easy determination by unauthorized users? (e.g., >6 characters)
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system verify password lengths and formats at the time of creation by users?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Are passwords prevented from access by ordinary means? (e.g., password file encryption)
Applicability of the Records to the System
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are loss management procedures in place to electronically de-authorize lost, stolen, missing or otherwise potentially compromised tokens, cards, and other devices that bear or generate identification code or password information?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the system detect and report any attempts at unauthorized use of User IDs to the system security unit and, as appropriate, organizational management?
Applicability of the Records to the System
Does the ES system provide a record of all security violations that include: User ID who created the violation; date/time of the violation; nature of the violation?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Does the system suspend user access after multiple unsuccessful consecutive attempts to enter a password until either: the security administrator resets the password; the system lock-out period expires?
Applicability of the Records to the System

Are devices such as tokens or cards that bear or generate identification code or password information periodically tested to ensure that they function properly and have not been altered in an unauthorized manner?
Applicability of the Records to the System

A system that contains electronic records and electronic signatures under all predicate rules

ItemData.Value: Per protocol, the entire record for each subject is to be signed electronically by the PI at completion of study. Or some such language.
REDI, a system of programs and processes that import data into selected subject records, in selected sites is used.
Refer to REDCap User Rights Assignment in this study.
Physical systems are secured and held within a hardened data center administered by UNC ITS I&O. Refer to REDCap assessment for details of REDCap security and audit logs.
User activation forms do not have any disclaimer language that answers this. It may exist elsewhere, but this needs to be addressed.
Revise language on User Activation form, or find other source of this language.
REDCap uses two auth schemes - UNC LDAP and internal, table-based authentication. UNC passwords are changed every 90 days, REDCap has a facility for enforcing this policy, but we don't use it.
Enforce the policy for changing REDCap passwords using the built-in tools.
Remote Desktop Connection system is provided by UNC ITS I&O. While RDC has the capability to enforce this policy, I&O does not do so.
Policy is not enforced within REDCap.
REDCap does not provide this, and there is no practical way to provide it outside of the application
